snippet: Tepco, whose Fukushima Daiichi nuclear plant suffered meltdowns after the tsunami last year, says it failed to take stronger preventive measures for fear of lawsuits or setting off safety concerns.
abstract: Tokyo Electric Power Company, operator of Japan’s stricken Fukushima Daiichi nuclear power plant, admits for first time it had failed to take stronger measures to prevent disasters for fear of inviting lawsuits or protests against its nuclear plants; company makes admission in report in which it showcases internal changes as the government considers when to allow other reactors to resume operation.
lead_paragraph: Tepco, whose Fukushima Daiichi nuclear plant suffered meltdowns after the tsunami last year, says it failed to take stronger preventive measures for fear of lawsuits or setting off safety concerns.

headline.seo: Tepco Admits Inadequate Precautions at Nuclear Plant
headline.main: Japan Power Company Admits Failings on Plant Precautions
headline.print_headline: Japan Power Company Admits Failings on Plant Precautions
